title: Guide to Zoom Video Conferencing
headline: In this free Zoom training course learn how to maximize the use of leading Zoom video conferencing and webinar software.
description: In this free online video conferencing training course you'll learn that Zoom is an easy-to-use video conferencing service. Zoom is very valuable to businesses and educational institutions as it allows users to easily organise virtual meetings, classrooms, and work remotely. Start this short course today and learn how to use Zoom features and make the best use of the service to meet your business or educational needs.

courseDescription:
This free online video conferencing training session begins by showing you how to sign up for a free Zoom account and download the necessary software onto your computer. It then goes on to teach you how to schedule a Zoom meeting from the Zoom web portal, your Google account, and Microsoft Outlook. You are then shown how to assign privileges in Zoom and Outlook and set up your audio and video settings.

Next, you are introduced to the basic in-meeting controls and shown how to manage participants in Zoom room meetings, launch polls, share content and manage users in your Zoom account. Next, you learn how to use Zoom Breakout and Waiting Rooms, manage Zoom conference rooms, record Zoom meetings, and review recorded playbacks. The course will then show you how to start or join Zoom meetings from the Skype for Business and Slack apps, set up a new Zoom phone account and Rooms Huddle kit, and access the Zoom dashboard.

Lastly, the video conferencing training session guide shows how to control your Zoom in-meeting experience, apply for Vanity URL, change share preferences, add managed domain, join a password-protected meeting, reshare a zoom room invitation link to reflect the recent Zoom security enhancements and connect with zoom 24x7 globally to support. If you are looking to organise virtual classrooms, meetings with co-workers or work remotely, this course is certainly for you. With this course, you will be able to easily and virtually interact with your co-workers, students or teachers using the Zoom service. Start this course now.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.description: Learn how Zoom has addressed the controversial "zoombombing" issue that has been the subject of so much discussion during the coronavirus lockdown.

slides:
• Getting Started

  • After completing this module you will be able to:
    • Sign up for a free Zoom account and download the necessary software onto your computer
    • Schedule a meeting in the Zoom web portal and configure various meeting settings
    • Invite panelists, set attendee registration and approval options and configure an invitation
    • Schedule your Zoom meetings directly from your Google account
    • Schedule and configure Zoom meetings in Microsoft Outlook
    • Assign scheduling privileges in Zoom and Outlook
    • Set up your audio and video settings prior to and during a Zoom meeting

  • Getting Started

    • In this module, you were shown how to sign up for a free Zoom account and download the necessary software onto your computer.
    • You were shown how to schedule a meeting in the Zoom web portal and configure various meeting settings.
    • You were shown how to invite panelists, set attendee registration and approval options and configure an invitation.
    • You learned how to schedule your Zoom meetings directly from your Google account, by installing the Google Chrome Zoom extension.
    • You were shown how to schedule and configure Zoom meetings in Microsoft Outlook.
    • You were shown how to assign scheduling privilege in Zoom and Outlook and schedule a Zoom meeting in Outlook, on behalf of someone else.
    • You learned how to set up your audio and video settings prior to joining a Zoom meeting and during a Zoom meeting.

  • Managing Zoom Meetings

  • After completing this module you will be able to:
    • Identify the basic in-meeting controls
    • Chat with other participants in a Zoom meeting
    • Manage participants in a Zoom meeting
    • Launch and share polls during a Zoom meeting
    • Share screen/contents within a Zoom meeting
    • Annotate your Zoom screen using the annotation tools and whiteboard capability
    • Add users to your Zoom account and manage licenses

  • Managing Zoom Meetings

    • In this module, you were shown the basic controls you can use during a Zoom meeting.
    • You learned how to chat with other participants in a Zoom meeting.
    • You learned how to manage participants in a meeting by using the gallery view feature, chatting with participants, and accessing the in-meeting settings in the Zoom web portal.
    • You learned how to launch polls, share poll results and also edit polls from the Zoom web portal.
    • You were shown how to share and manage screen/content within a Zoom meeting, and also configure the sharing options.
    • You were shown how to annotate using the Zooms whiteboard capability and annotation tools.
    • You were shown how to add users to your Zoom account and manage your Zoom licenses.

    • Review recorded playbacks from your Zoom account
    • Select appropriate virtual backgrounds for Zoom meetings

  • Zoom Rooms and Recording

    • In this module, you were shown how to activate and create Zoom Breakout Rooms, and also move and assign participants to those rooms.
    • You learned how to create breakout rooms and pre-assign participants into breakout rooms through the Zoom web portal.
    • You learned how to use the waiting room feature to schedule meetings, and also admit and remove participants.
    • You were shown how to manage Zoom conference rooms by enabling room alerts and checking their status.
    • You were shown how to record Zoom meetings to your computer or cloud.
    • You learned how to access, review and share cloud recordings.
    • You were shown how to use and get the best results from the Zoom Virtual Background, add image and adjust virtual background in a meeting.

  • Zoom Integrations and Setups

  • After completing this module you will be able to:
    • Start or join a Zoom meeting through the Skype for Business app
    • Start and join a Zoom meeting from the Slack app
    • Make and receive calls using the Zoom phone app
    • Set up a Zoom phone account
    • Access and download reports from the Zoom dashboard
    • Set up your Zoom Rooms Huddle kit

  • Zoom Integrations and Setups

    • In this module, you were shown how to use the Skype for Business app to start and join Zoom meetings.
    • You learned how to integrate Zoom with Slack, so you can join and start a Zoom meeting from the Slack app.
    • You were shown how to make and receive calls using the Zoom phone app.

    • You learned about the Zoom dashboard, and how to access reports on meetings.
    • You learned the steps to setting up your Zoom Rooms Huddle Kit.

  • Zoom Security

  • After completing this module you will be able to:
    • Control your Zoom in-meeting experience using various Zoom features
    • Apply for a vanity URL from your Zoom account
    • Change sharing preferences from the Zoom portal
    • Add and verify managed domains in your Zoom account
    • Enable other participants to share their screen during a Zoom meeting
    • Join a password protected Zoom meeting
    • Re-share a Zoom meeting link to include the recent Zoom meeting security enhancements

    • You were shown how to apply for Vanity URL in your Zoom account.
    • You were shown how to change your sharing preferences within the Zoom portal.
    • You learned the steps to adding and verifying managed domains in your Zoom account.
